comments.body:
Sure I will add the file. I have a question about the output files in te recipe. My project builds two shared libraries and an executable
libpynumero_ASL.so
libpynumero_SPARSE.so
asl_test
CI is building correctly the libraries and the executable but conda is not finding them and its giving the warning 
WARNING: No files or script found for output pynumero_build
Is there a way to specify in the recipe that I want those three files in the output?

Thanks!
An easy way is just to copy your shared objects into ``$PREFIX/lib`` in your build script

Thank you very much Marcelo. I think now is working. However is giving me some warnings. Can you comment on the following warnings:

On CI:
WARNING (pynumero_build,lib/libpynumero_ASL.so): /lib64/libdl.so.2 not found in sysroot, is this binary repackaging? .. do you need to use install_name_tool/patchelf?

On Travis:
WARNING (pynumero_build,bin/asl_test): Needed DSO /usr/lib/libc++.1.dylib not found in any CDT/compiler package, nor the whitelist?!

Just the second one may be a problem

Try to add ``ampl-mp`` in run requirements.

But I think that's fine. I will mark @ocefpaf to also take a look on that
Let's call the experts @isuruf and @msarahan here :smile:

Thanks Marcelo and Filipe,

Initially I was planning on distributing the libraries by precompiling them so I am compiling with -static-libstdc++. I wonder if I can get rid of that flag now and let conda export the libc++ together with my libraries.
Both warnings can be ignored since we are using toolchain for now.
I just added the license file to the source. Seen that the build is passing I believe the pull request can be merged?

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +38,42 @@about:
  home: https://github.com/santiagoropb/pynumero_libraries.git
  license: BSD
  license_file: LICENSE.txt
  summary: 'Libraries for PyNumero, a python package for numerical optimization'
